medical_history.chief_complaint: Chronic telogen effluvium with continuous excessive hair shedding.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Hair shedding began suddenly, with the patient able to collect between 40 and 150 hairs per day. The patient estimated a 50% reduction in the thickness of her ponytail over the preceding 18 months. The shedding persisted for 18 months without relief.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hashimotoâ€™s thyroiditis, treated with thyroxine and euthyroid.
medical_history.family_history: Father died at 40; was Hamilton stage IV at the time of death. Sister experienced a single patch of alopecia areata that regrew spontaneously.
